The Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic

  1. Every composite number can be expressed (factorised) as a product of primes
  2. Also, this factorization is unique, apart from the order in which the prime factors occur.

    3. For given positive integers a and b:

    HCF of two integers = Product of the smallest power of each common prime factor in the numbers.

    LCM of two integers = Product of the greatest power of each prime factor, involved in the numbers.

    \(LCM\times HCF = a\times b\)
